userreviews.userReview: Yeah i read it.It's okay to be jealous, i'd be jealous of me too.But seriously put this on your TBR people.
✨ my first ever added book... I think? but either way GUYS PLEASE READ THIS BLURB THIS IS ALL IM GOING TO THINK ABOUT FOR THE NEXT TWO YEARS. I DON'T WANT TO LIVE IN A WORLD WHERE I HAVEN'T READ THIS

fun fact: this is all ive ever needed in my entire life﻿.  how am i a little in love with this book even though i haven't read a single page of it? i think it's because i'm so fucking glad it is a thing that will be published. it has a little of my heart in that way.@ all publishers i want more of queer own voices in every genre imaginable please

I wrote this book, and it's pretty rad, if I do say so myself (though, over the past 3 years it damn near killed me...the price of art, ya know?). But you can judge for yourself Summer 2019. I hope you enjoy and love these characters, this world, and journey against all odds as much as I do.
Since my parents are from Albania/Kosovo and my family has been through the war in Kosovo this is something I really can‘t wait to read!!! 2019 is soo far away though 😭
F*ck yes I want to read
"Pitched as Code Name Verity meets Aristotle and Dante" OH MY GOD SAY NO MORE, I'M SCREAMING SO HARD. I NEED THIS BOOK.
i didn’t even read the summary just saw two poc queer boys and shelved djsjsjsjns
omg???? two poc queer boys??? SIGN ME THE FUCK UP ALREADY i'm all in for this one
Pitched as Code Name Verity meets my precious Ari and Dante?Say no more, fam.

description: Pitched as Code Name Verity meets Aristotle and Dante Discover the Secrets of the Universe, this #ownvoices historical thriller follows two boys who can only rely on each other as they travel through war-torn Kosovo. Set to release in summer 2019.https://twitter.com/KosokoJackson/sta...
title: A Place For Wolves
